      private Connections SpatialPoolerTest.mem 
      Methods in org.numenta.nupic.algorithms with parameters of type Connections 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void TemporalMemory.activateCorrectlyPredictiveCells(Connections cnx, ComputeCycle c, java.util.Set<Cell> prevPredictiveCells, java.util.Set<Cell> prevMatchingCells, java.util.Set<Column> activeColumns)
      Phase 1: Activate the correctly predictive cells Pseudocode: - for each previous predictive cell - if in active column - mark it as active - mark it as winner cell - mark column as predicted - if not in active column - mark it as a predicted but inactive cell
      void SpatialPooler.adaptSynapses(Connections c, int[] inputVector, int[] activeColumns)
      The primary method in charge of learning.
      double SpatialPooler.avgColumnsPerInput(Connections c)
      The average number of columns per input, taking into account the topology of the inputs and columns.
      double SpatialPooler.avgConnectedSpanForColumnND(Connections c, int columnIndex)
      The range of connectedSynapses per column, averaged for each dimension.
      void SpatialPooler.bumpUpWeakColumns(Connections c)
      This method increases the permanence values of synapses of columns whose activity level has been too low.
      void TemporalMemory.burstColumns(ComputeCycle cycle, Connections c, java.util.Set<Column> activeColumns, java.util.Set<Column> predictedColumns, java.util.Set<Cell> prevActiveCells, java.util.Set<Cell> prevWinnerCells)
      Phase 2: Burst unpredicted columns.
      int[] SpatialPooler.calculateOverlap(Connections c, int[] inputVector)
      This function determines each column's overlap with the current input vector.
      double[] SpatialPooler.calculateOverlapPct(Connections c, int[] overlaps)
      Return the overlap to connected counts ratio for a given column
      ComputeCycle TemporalMemory.compute(Connections connections, int[] activeColumns, boolean learn)
      Feeds input record through TM, performing inferencing and learning
      void SpatialPooler.compute(Connections c, int[] inputVector, int[] activeArray, boolean learn, boolean stripNeverLearned)
      This is the primary public method of the SpatialPooler class.
      ComputeCycle TemporalMemory.computeFn(Connections c, java.util.Set<Column> activeColumns, java.util.Set<Cell> prevPredictiveCells, java.util.Set<DistalDendrite> prevActiveSegments, java.util.Set<Cell> prevActiveCells, java.util.Set<Cell> prevWinnerCells, java.util.Set<DistalDendrite> prevMatchingSegments, java.util.Set<Cell> prevMatchingCells, boolean learn)
      Functional version of #compute(int[], boolean).
      void TemporalMemory.computePredictiveCells(Connections c, ComputeCycle cycle, java.util.Set<Cell> activeCells)
      Phase 4: Compute predictive cells due to lateral input on distal dendrites.
      void SpatialPooler.connectAndConfigureInputs(Connections c)
      Step two of pooler initialization kept separate from initialization of static members so that they may be set at a different point in the initialization (as sometimes needed by tests).
      TemporalMemory.CellSearch TemporalMemory.getBestMatchingCell(Connections c, java.util.List<Cell> columnCells, java.util.Set<Cell> activeCells)
      Gets the cell with the best matching segment (see `TM.bestMatchingSegment`) that has the largest number of active synapses of all best matching segments.
      TemporalMemory.SegmentSearch TemporalMemory.getBestMatchingSegment(Connections c, Cell columnCell, java.util.Set<Cell> activeCells)
      Gets the segment on a cell with the largest number of activate synapses, including all synapses with non-zero permanences.
      Cell TemporalMemory.getLeastUsedCell(Connections c, java.util.List<Cell> columnCells)
      Gets the cell with the smallest number of segments.
      TIntArrayList SpatialPooler.getNeighborsND(Connections c, int columnIndex, SparseMatrix<?> topology, int inhibitionRadius, boolean wrapAround)
      Similar to _getNeighbors1D and _getNeighbors2D (Not included in this implementation), this function Returns a list of indices corresponding to the neighbors of a given column.
      int[] SpatialPooler.inhibitColumns(Connections c, double[] overlaps)

      Performs inhibition.
      void TemporalMemory.init(Connections c)
      Uses the specified Connections object to Build the structural anatomy needed by this TemporalMemory to implement its algorithms.
      void SpatialPooler.init(Connections c)
      Initializes the specified Connections object which contains the memory and structural anatomy this spatial pooler uses to implement its algorithms.
      void SpatialPooler.initMatrices(Connections c)
      Called to initialize the structural anatomy with configured values and prepare the anatomical entities for activation.
      double[] SpatialPooler.initPermanence(Connections c, int[] potentialPool, int index, double connectedPct)
      Initializes the permanences of a column.
      static double SpatialPooler.initPermConnected(Connections c)
      Returns a randomly generated permanence value for a synapse that is initialized in a connected state.
      static double SpatialPooler.initPermNonConnected(Connections c)
      Returns a randomly generated permanence value for a synapses that is to be initialized in a non-connected state.
      boolean SpatialPooler.isUpdateRound(Connections c)
      Returns true if enough rounds have passed to warrant updates of duty cycles
      void TemporalMemory.learnOnSegments(Connections c, java.util.Set<DistalDendrite> prevActiveSegments, java.util.Set<DistalDendrite> learningSegments, java.util.Set<Cell> prevActiveCells, java.util.Set<Cell> winnerCells, java.util.Set<Cell> prevWinnerCells, java.util.Set<Cell> predictedInactiveCells, java.util.Set<DistalDendrite> prevMatchingSegments)
      Phase 3: Perform learning by adapting segments.
      int SpatialPooler.mapColumn(Connections c, int columnIndex)
      Maps a column to its respective input index, keeping to the topology of the region.

      Maps a column to its input bits.
      void SpatialPooler.raisePermanenceToThreshold(Connections c, double[] perm, int[] maskPotential)
      This method ensures that each column has enough connections to input bits to allow it to become active.
      void SpatialPooler.raisePermanenceToThresholdSparse(Connections c, double[] perm)
      This method ensures that each column has enough connections to input bits to allow it to become active.
      void TemporalMemory.reset(Connections connections)
      Called to start the input of a new sequence, and reset the sequence state of the TM.
      TIntArrayList SpatialPooler.stripUnlearnedColumns(Connections c, int[] activeColumns)
      Removes the set of columns who have never been active from the set of active columns selected in the inhibition round.
      void SpatialPooler.updateBookeepingVars(Connections c, boolean learn)
      Updates counter instance variables each cycle.
      void SpatialPooler.updateBoostFactors(Connections c)
      Update the boost factors for all columns.
      void SpatialPooler.updateDutyCycles(Connections c, int[] overlaps, int[] activeColumns)
      Updates the duty cycles for each column.

      Updates a duty cycle estimate with a new value.

      Update the inhibition radius.
      void SpatialPooler.updateMinDutyCycles(Connections c)
      Updates the minimum duty cycles defining normal activity for a column.

      Updates the minimum duty cycles in a global fashion.
